job_details.Functieomschrijving: As a Data Engineer, you play a pivotal role in the design, development, and operation of digital products. You will be part of the full product development process in digital product teams, from understanding the problem, through designing the solution by quick prototyping, then delivering and running our services in production.
job_details.full_text:
Data engineer

As a Data Engineer, you play a pivotal role in the design, development, and operation of digital products. You will be part of the full product development process in digital product teams, from understanding the problem, through designing the solution by quick prototyping, then delivering and running our services in production.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on general data engineering tasks within product development teams without specifying any AI or ML components. It lacks the core elements of modeling, generative techniques, or MLOps typically associated with ML or GenAI Engineer roles.

phrases: design, development, and operation of digital products
delivering and running our services in production
job_tasks.justification: These phrases indicate a focus on building and maintaining data infrastructure and services, which is the core of data engineering.

phrases: part of the full product development process
designing the solution by quick prototyping
delivering and running our services in production
job_tasks.justification: The role involves participating in the entire product development lifecycle, including prototyping and deploying services, which aligns with software development responsibilities.

phrases: designing the solution by quick prototyping
delivering and running our services in production
soft_skills.justification: These phrases highlight the need to understand issues, rapidly create solutions, and ensure services are operational, indicating a pragmatic problem-solving approach.

phrases: delivering and running our services in production
soft_skills.justification: Involvement in the full product lifecycle, including prototyping and production deployment, suggests a need for initiative and ownership of the development process.
